bill_title: to provide a procedure for requesting visitation rights if not established by court order or decree.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide a procedure for requesting visitation rights if not established by court order or decree. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 25-4A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If any person is legally entitled to visitation of a child and the visitation rights have not been previously established by court order or decree, the person may file a written request with the court to establish reasonable visitation rights. Upon receipt of a written request to establish visitation rights, the court may issue an order to show cause to the other party and shall schedule a hearing within thirty days. No particular formality is required of the moving party in making the written request for the establishment of visitation rights. At the hearing, the court shall determine if visitation is in the best interests of the child and enter an appropriate order. The court may also order mediation as provided by § § 25-4-56 to 25-4-62, inclusive, if deemed appropriate under the circumstances. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.015 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
